newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Aerolineas Argentinas to choose partner next week.
newsitem.headline: Aerolineas Argentinas to choose partner next week.

text.p: Aerolineas Argentinas will decide next week which carrier will pick up a stake of around 20 percent in the airline on offer by Spain's government, the local business daily Ambito Financiero said.
"Next week we will decide on the incorporation of our new North American partner," Aerolineas President Manuel Moran said in statements published by the newspaper.
Both AMR Corp's American Airlines and Continental Airlines Inc are keen to buy the stake, he said, but gave no clues as to which it will be.

Former U.S. ambassador to Argentina James Cheek, now acting as an advisor to American, recently promised "nobody will make a better offer than American" after a meeting with Argentine President Carlos Menem.
Moran said that within 60 days Aerolineas will be operating with its new partner.
Spain's government owns a total of around 45 percent of Aerolineas through a holding company and state owned airline Iberia's stake in Argentina's flag carrier.

Moran added that the airline intends to set up a new company called Aero Handling, to carry out luggage handling services at Buenos Aires' international airport Ezeiza and six other airports in the interior of the country.
